events.name: France Unveils National Ecological Plan
events.wd_description: President Emmanuel Macron revealed a national ecological plan aimed at reducing France’s greenhouse gas emissions by 55% and ending the use of fossil fuels by 2030.
events.description: President Emmanuel Macron revealed a national ecological plan aimed at reducing France’s greenhouse gas emissions by 55% and ending the use of fossil fuels by 2030.

events.name: Announcement by President Macron
events.wd_description: President Emmanuel Macron announced the ecological plan after a special ministerial council at the Elysee.
events.description: President Emmanuel Macron announced the ecological plan after a special ministerial council at the Elysee.

events.name: Key Measures of the Plan
events.wd_description: The plan includes measures such as speeding up the production of electric cars, brakes on gas boilers, new offshore wind farm projects, and opening several electric battery factories in northern France.
events.description: The plan includes measures such as speeding up the production of electric cars, brakes on gas boilers, new offshore wind farm projects, and opening several electric battery factories in northern France.

events.name: Investment and Funding
events.wd_description: An additional €10bn will be spent to execute the 50-point ecological program.
events.description: An additional €10bn will be spent to execute the 50-point ecological program.

events.name: Industrial Pollution Reduction Agreement
events.wd_description: Companies responsible for 50 of the dirtiest industrial sites in France are expected to sign an agreement to reduce pollution by 45% before the end of 2030.
events.description: Companies responsible for 50 of the dirtiest industrial sites in France are expected to sign an agreement to reduce pollution by 45% before the end of 2030.

events.name: Control of Electricity Prices
events.wd_description: Full control of electricity prices will return to the state by next month, as part of the plan.
events.description: Full control of electricity prices will return to the state by next month, as part of the plan.

events.name: Russia Bans 54 British Nationals
events.wd_description: Russia has banned 54 British nationals and individuals associated with organizations in the United Kingdom from entering the country in retaliation for U.K. sanctions on Russian citizens.
events.description: Russia has banned 54 British nationals and individuals associated with organizations in the United Kingdom from entering the country in retaliation for U.K. sanctions on Russian citizens.

events.name: Sanctioned Individuals
events.wd_description: Among those sanctioned by Russia are the U.K. Cultural Secretary Lucy Frazer, ICC Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan, and Minister of State for Defense Annabel Goldie.
events.description: Among those sanctioned by Russia are the U.K. Cultural Secretary Lucy Frazer, ICC Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan, and Minister of State for Defense Annabel Goldie.

events.name: Reason for Sanctions
events.wd_description: Russia's foreign ministry stated that the sanctions were imposed in response to the U.K.'s sanctions on Russian citizens.
events.description: Russia's foreign ministry stated that the sanctions were imposed in response to the U.K.'s sanctions on Russian citizens.

events.name: Context of Western Sanctions
events.wd_description: The United Kingdom is among the Western countries that have sanctioned Russia in response to its war with Ukraine in 2022, with over 1,000 businesses and individuals sanctioned by the U.S., EU, U.K., and other countries.
events.description: The United Kingdom is among the Western countries that have sanctioned Russia in response to its war with Ukraine in 2022, with over 1,000 businesses and individuals sanctioned by the U.S., EU, U.K., and other countries.

events.name: Military Coup in Gabon
events.wd_description: Military officers in Gabon have announced the takeover from President Ali Bongo, ending the family's half-century rule over the country. The announcement has led to celebrations and reports of gunfire on the capital's streets.
events.description: Military officers in Gabon have announced the takeover from President Ali Bongo, ending the family's half-century rule over the country. The announcement has led to celebrations and reports of gunfire on the capital's streets.

events.name: Announcement on National Television
events.wd_description: Men in uniform announced the military takeover on national television, stating that they have placed President Ali Bongo under house arrest.
events.description: Men in uniform announced the military takeover on national television, stating that they have placed President Ali Bongo under house arrest.

events.name: House Arrest of President Ali Bongo
events.wd_label: House Arrest of President Ali Bongo
events.wd_description: President Ali Bongo has been placed under house arrest by the military officers who staged the coup.
events.description: President Ali Bongo has been placed under house arrest by the military officers who staged the coup.

events.name: Designation of Transition President
events.wd_description: General Brice Oligui Nguema has been designated as the president of the transition by the Committee for the Transition and Restoration of Institutions (CTRI).
events.description: General Brice Oligui Nguema has been designated as the president of the transition by the Committee for the Transition and Restoration of Institutions (CTRI).

events.name: Investigations and Arrests
events.wd_description: Investigations will be launched against President Bongo’s son, who was arrested alongside six other individuals for high treason.
events.description: Investigations will be launched against President Bongo’s son, who was arrested alongside six other individuals for high treason.

events.name: Shutdown of Institutions and Borders
events.wd_description: The junta confirmed that the election result would be voided, all borders would be shut, and all institutions in the country would be shut down.
events.description: The junta confirmed that the election result would be voided, all borders would be shut, and all institutions in the country would be shut down.

events.name: Canada-Japan Cooperation on Battery Supply Chains
events.wd_label: Canada-Japan Cooperation on Battery Supply Chains
events.wd_description: Canada and Japan have agreed to work more closely together to establish sustainable and reliable global battery supply chains.
events.description: Canada and Japan have agreed to work more closely together to establish sustainable and reliable global battery supply chains.

events.name: Memorandum of Cooperation
events.wd_description: Canada and Japan signed a memorandum of cooperation to strengthen their collaboration on global battery supply chains during a visit by Japanese Industry Minister Yasutoshi Nishimura.
events.description: Canada and Japan signed a memorandum of cooperation to strengthen their collaboration on global battery supply chains during a visit by Japanese Industry Minister Yasutoshi Nishimura.

events.name: Canada's Green Technology Initiative
events.wd_description: Canada aims to attract firms involved in all levels of the electric vehicle (EV) supply chain through a multibillion-dollar green technology initiative.
events.description: Canada aims to attract firms involved in all levels of the electric vehicle (EV) supply chain through a multibillion-dollar green technology initiative.

events.name: Mining Sector Development
events.wd_description: Canada is home to a large mining sector for minerals such as lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are critical for battery production.
events.description: Canada is home to a large mining sector for minerals such as lithium, nickel, and cobalt, which are critical for battery production.

events.name: New Facility in Quebec
events.wd_description: A unit of South Korea's Solus Advanced Materials announced it would build a copper foil facility in Quebec, producing technology for EV batteries.
events.description: A unit of South Korea's Solus Advanced Materials announced it would build a copper foil facility in Quebec, producing technology for EV batteries.
